doc.ContractDescription: DATA FROM OTHER STARS CAN HELP SOLAR DYNAMO MODELS, PUTTING MORE ON CONSTRAINTS ON THE MODELS, AND THEN TESTING THEM OVER A WIDE RANGE OF PROPERTIES. A SURPRISING AMOUNT OF INFORMATION CAN BE GLEANED WITH CAREFUL ANALYSIS OF A VARIETY OF STELLAR DATA. STARTING WITH EXISTING DATABASES AND PUBLISHED VALUES, AND LATER USING DATA GENERATED BY OTHER FST AND THE GROWING VSSO DATABASE, WE PROPOSE TO: 1) GENERATE CYCLE PERIODS, AMPLITUDES, SECONDARY PERIODS, ROTATIONAL PERIODS, SURFACE DIFFERENTIAL ROTATION, DIFFUSIVITY AND MERIDIONAL FLOW ESTIMATES, IDENTIFY ACTIVITY BELTS, AND SEE HOW ALL THESE VARY WITH MASS AND AGE. 2) EXPLORE MASS AND AGE DEPENDENCE OF STARS WHICH MAY BE IN MAGNETIC GRAND MINIMA, AND IMPROVE CA II HK CALIBRATION, 3) DETERMINE HOW THE RATES OF LARGE FLARES AND CMES VARY WITH MASS AND AGE, AND 4) EXPLORE NEW DYNAMO CYCLE PROXIES. THESE WILL BE GENERATED FROM EXISTING DATA AND DATASETS INITIALLY AND SENT TO THE DYNAMO MODELING TEAMS AND THE VSSO; LATER IMPROVEMENTS AND ADDITIONAL CONSTRAINTS WILL BE DERIVED FROM NEW DATA COMING INTO THE VSSO AND FROM OTHER SOURCES. THESE RESULTS WILL LAY A CRUCIAL FOUNDATION FOR IMPROVING OUR PHYSICAL UNDERSTANDING OF THE DYNAMOS OF SOLAR-TYPE STARS AND HOW THEY EVOLVE IN TIME.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF GE HEALTHCARE BIO-SCIENCES - PURCHASE OF A PURCHASE OF TYPHOON FLA9500 BIOMOLECULAR IMAGER.
VALVE

GLOBAL HELIOSEISMOLOGY USING HMI OBSERVATIONS DURING CYCLE 24: MONITORING THE STRUCTURE AND DYNAMICS OF THE SOLAR INTERIOR WITH STATE OF THE ART PMODE CHARACTERIZATION HSPH TO SOL THE AIM OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO CARRY ON THE PRECISE AND ACCURATE MONITORING OF BOTH THE STRUCTURE AND DYNAMICS OF THE SOLAR INTERIOR USING HMI OBSERVATIONS AND GLOBAL HELIOSEISMIC TECHNIQUES. THIS WOULD ALLOW ME TO CONTINUE MY SUCCESSFUL WORK FUNDED BY A LIVING WITH A STAR PROGRAM ENTITLED "GLOBAL HELIOSEISMOLOGY IN THE ERA OF SDO". THE TECHNICAL ASPECTS OF THIS PROPOSAL ARE (A) TO APPLY MY STATE-OF-THE-ART FITTING METHODOLOGY TO NEW HMI OBSERVATIONS; (B) FURTHER SCRUTINIZE THE METHODOLOGY ITSELF FOR POTENTIAL BIASES THAT MAY EXPLAIN DISCREPANCIES WITH THE MDI/HMI TEAM RESULTS AND (C) EXPLOIT THE FACT THAT WE ALSO HAVE INTENSITY OBSERVATIONS. MY METHOD PROVIDES AN INVALUABLE ALTERNATIVE TO THE STANDARD GLOBAL HELIOSEISMIC REDUCTION PIPELINE. A SECOND TASK WILL BE TO CONTINUE FITTING NEW HMI OBSERVATIONS USING MY METHODOLOGY, AND THUS TO CONTINUE PRODUCING AN INDEPENDENT SET OF MODE CHARACTERISTICS, A SET THAT HAS BEEN SHOWN TO BE SELF CONSISTENT WITH A VERY LOW ATTRITION LEVEL. AS MORE DATA IS ACQUIRED, LONGER TIME SERIES OF HMI OBSERVATIONS WILL BE FITTED. THESE WILL IN TURN PRODUCE MORE ACCURATE ESTIMATES, TRADING TEMPORAL RESOLUTION FOR ACCURACY, AND ALLOWING US TO MAKE MORE ACCURATE INFERENCES AND COMPARISONS IN DEEPER PARTS OF THE SOLAR INTERIOR. I WILL CONTINUE TO EXPLOIT THESE RESULTS USING THE BEST INVERSION TECHNIQUES, BOTH FOR ROTATION AND FOR STRUCTURE. THIS WILL ALLOW ME TO MONITOR THE CHANGES OF THE INTERNAL SOLAR ROTATION DURING MOST OF CYCLE 24, AND ALLOW US TO CONFIRM WHETHER CYCLE 24 IS SIGNIFICANTLY DIFFERENT FROM CYCLE 23, AS SUGGESTED BY THE UNUSUAL LONG LAST MINIMUM AND RESULTS AT HAND OVER THE RISING PART OF CYCLE 24. THIS WILL GIVE US PRECISE AND CONSISTENT MODE CHARACTERISTICS OVER A FULL MAGNETIC CYCLE (22 YEARS) AND HELP US BETTER UNDERSTAND THE INTERACTION BETWEEN THE CHANGES OF THE SOLAR DIFFERENTIAL ROTATION, ITS STRUCTURE AND THE MAGNETIC FIELD AND HOW THAT INTERACTION AFFECTS THE EMERGENCE OF THE FIELD AT THE SURFACE. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE ORIGINS OF THE SUN'S ACTIVITY (KEY SCIENCE GOAL #1 OF THE HELIOPHYSICS DECADAL SURVEY) AND FURTHER KEY SCIENCE GOAL #4 BY CONTRIBUTING TO OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE SOLAR DYNAMO, AND THEREFORE SIMILAR DYNAMOS. THIS PROPOSAL WILL DRAW EXTENSIVELY FROM THE DATA SET PRODUCED BY HMI ON SDO, A DATA SET THAT WILL BE COMPLEMENTED BY SIMULTANEOUS GROUND-BASED OBSERVATIONS ACQUIRED BY THE NSF FUNDED GONG PROJECT.
doc.MajorAgency: GLOBAL HELIOSEISMOLOGY USING HMI OBSERVATIONS DURI
doc.MajorFundingAgency: GLOBAL HELIOSEISMOLOGY USING HMI OBSERVATIONS DURI

KEY OBJECTIVES: EARTH SCIENTISTS ARE STRUGGLING TO EXTRACT NEW INSIGHTS FROM A SEA OF LARGE DATA SETS ORIGINATING FROM MULTIPLE INSTRUMENTS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO PROVIDE ENHANCED ASSISTANCE TO ENABLE THE MOST BENEFICIAL DIVISION BETWEEN HUMAN AND MACHINE EFFORTS. WE PROPOSE THE CREATION OF ENHANCED ENVIRONMENTS FOR COMPUTER-AIDED DISCOVERY THAT SUPPORT HUMANS IN THE SEARCH PROCESS OF MAKING NEW DISCOVERIES RELATED TO EARTH SURFACE DEFORMATION PHENOMENA.

doc.ContractDescription: MULTIMEDIA CONFERENCE ROOM- EQUIPMENT AND INSTALL

OUR OVERARCHING GOAL IS TO DEVELOP ROBUST ALGORITHMS TO RETRIEVE WATER QUALITY PROPERTIES FROM SATELLITE OCEAN COLOR DATA MEASURED OVER OPTICALLY SHALLOW WATERS OSWS, SINCE CURRENT OCEAN COLOR PROCESSING ALGORITHMS ARE UNABLE TO REMOVE THE BOTTOM EFFECTS IN SUCH IMPORTANT AQUATIC ENVIRONMENTS. THIS PROJECT WILL USE BOTH SIMULATED AND IN SITU DATA TO DETERMINE THE OPTIMAL ALGORITHM ARCHITECTURE AND ALGORITHM PARAMETERIZATION FOR THIS GOAL. IN PARTICULAR, BECAUSE OF THE RICHNESS IN HABITATS AND THE ECOLOGICAL AND ECONOMIC IMPORTANCE, WE WILL USE THE SHALLOW WATERS IN THE FLORIDA REGION THE WEST FLORIDA SHELF, TAMPA BAY, SOUTH FLORIDA, FLORIDA KEYS, AND BAHAMAS AS A TEST BED FOR THE GENERATION AND EVALUATION OF WATER QUALITY PROPERTIES IN SHALLOW WATERS FROM SATELLITE OCEAN COLOR DATA. THE SIGNIFICANT OUTCOMES OF THIS EFFORT WILL INCLUDE ROBUST ALGORITHMS DOCUMENTATION, AUXILIARY DATASET, AND SEADAS COMPATIBLE SOFTWARE FOR PROCESSING SATELLITE OCEAN COLOR DATA OVER OSWS, WHICH WILL FILL THE VOID IN GENERATING RELIABLE WATER QUALITY PRODUCTS FOR SUCH ENVIRONMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH AN EFFECTIVE DATABASE MAPS OF BOTTOM PROPERTIES DEPTH, REFLECTANCE, AND BOTTOM TYPE FOR OSWS IN THE FLORIDA REGION. IN COMBINATION WITH EXISTING ALGORITHMS DEVELOPED AND VALIDATED FOR OPTICALLY DEEP WATERS, THE ALGORITHM SUITE WITH APPROPRIATE AUXILIARY DATASET WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE SEAMLESS WATER QUALITY PRODUCTS FROM DEEP TO SHALLOW WATERS, WHICH WILL HAVE A BROAD IMPACT ON THE MONITORING AND STUDY OF DELICATE CORAL REEF AND SEA GRASS ECOSYSTEMS BEYOND OUR STUDY REGION. FURTHERMORE, THE ALGORITHM SUITE WILL BE APPLIED TO MORE THAN A DECADE OF SATELLITE SEAWIFS, MODIS MEASUREMENTS TO DOCUMENT AND EVALUATE DECADAL CHANGES OF WATER QUALITY IN THE FLORIDA REGION, AND TO STUDY THEIR POTENTIAL LINKS WITH CLIMATE VARIABILITY AND HUMAN IMPACTS. RESULTS OF THESE CASE STUDIES WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT MANAGEMENT DECISION MAKING, FOR EXAMPLE BY PROVIDING BASELINE DATA TO THE CURRENT RE ZONING EFFORT OF THE FLORIDA KEYS NATIONAL MARINE SANCTUARY. THIS PROPOSAL IS A DIRECT RESPONSE TO NASA ROSES 2012 NNH11ZDA001N A.32 SUB ELEMENT 2.2.2 SHALLOW WATER. THE RESULTS WILL HELP ADDRESS SCIENCE ISSUES RELATED TO NASA SCIENCE MISSION DIRECTORATE STRATEGIC GOAL IA. STUDY PLANET EARTH FROM SPACE TO ADVANCE SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING AND MEET SOCIETAL NEEDS. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT SIGNIFICANTLY FROM THE EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE AND EXPERTISE OF THE TEAM MEMBERS WORKING ON THIS TOPIC, AND FROM THE EXISTING DATA PROCESSING INFRASTRUCTURE ESTABLISHED FROM PAST AND CURRENT NASA PROJECTS.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CL,CT::IGF PROCUREMENT OF PROFESSIONAL ACQUISITION SUPPORT SERVICES

WE PROPOSE AN MIT-GISS COLLABORATION TO INVESTIGATE THE SENSITIVITY OF HEAT AND CARBON UPTAKE IN A HIERARCHY OF COUPLED CLIMATE MODELS TO THE REPRESENTATION OF MIXING PROCESSES IN THE OCEAN COMPONENT OF THE COUPLED SYSTEM IN A WORLD OF INCREASING GHG AND CLIMATE CHANGE. OUR GOAL IS TO DETERMINE THE ROBUSTNESS OF THE RESPONSE OF THE COUPLED SYSTEM TO TRANSIENT (I.E. DECADAL TO CENTENNIAL) CO2 CLIMATE FORCING, TO THE REPRESENTATION OF OCEAN PROCESSES THEREIN. GISS##S MODEL-E AND ITS USE IN STUDIES OF CLIMATE CHANGE WILL PROVIDE THE MODELING CONTEXT. IDEALIZED MODELS WILL BE ALSO BE STUDIED IN WHICH OCEAN EDDIES ARE RESOLVED RATHER THAN PARAMETERIZED, PROVIDING A TESTBED FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF PARAMETERIZATIONS. BACKGROUND CLIMATE MODEL DEVELOPMENT AT GISS HAS SOUGHT TO ADDRESS UNCERTAINTIES IN THE REPRESENTATION OF THE OCEAN BY COUPLING THE GISS AGCM WITH TWO DISTINCTLY DIFFERENT OCEAN CIRCULATION MODELS, BLECK##S HYCOM AND RUSSELL##S GISS OCEAN MODEL. THESE MODELS EMPLOY DIFFERENT VERTICAL COORDINATE SYSTEMS WITH INHERENTLY DIFFERENT IMPLICATIONS FOR MIXING AND THE REPRESENTATION OF EDDIES THEREIN. THE FORMER USES ISOPYCNALS AS A VERTICAL COORDINATE, THE LATTER PRESSURE. AS PART OF THE PROPOSED GISS MODEL DEVELOPMENT PLAN, THE GISS MIXING AND EDDY-PARAMETERIZATION SCHEMES DEVELOPED BY CANUTO AND HIS GROUP ARE BEING BROUGHT IN TO BOTH OCEAN MODELS AND EVALUATED IN COUPLED CLIMATE AND CLIMATE CHANGE SCENARIOS. MOREOVER ROMANOU HAS NOW COUPLED IN THE NASA OCEAN BIOGEOCHEMISTRY MODULE TO BOTH OCEAN MODELS AND INVESTIGATES RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE SOLUBILITY, BIOLOGICAL AND CARBONATE PUMPS. GISS IS THEREFORE IN A VERY STRONG POSITION TO ADDRESS AND INVESTIGATE UNCERTAINTIES IN HEAT AND CARBON UPTAKE AND STORAGE IN THE OCEAN TO OCEAN MODEL FORMULATION. MIT HAS A LONGSTANDING RELATIONSHIP WITH GISS WHICH IS CONTINUING THROUGH MARSHALL##S COLLABORATION WITH THE OCEAN MODELING GROUP AT GISS. THIS PROPOSAL WILL MAKE USE OF IDEALIZED MODELS OF THE SOUTHERN OCEAN DEVELOPED AT MIT WHICH EMBED AN EDDYING ANTARCTIC IRCUMPOLAR CURRENT WITHIN A COARSELY-RESOLVED GLOBAL CIRCULATION AND OVERLAIN CARBON CYCLE MODELS. IT WILL BE DRIVEN BY GLOBAL CHANGE SCENARIOS MOTIVATED BY GISS##S COUPLED MODEL. THIS WILL PROVIDE A REFERENCE SOLUTION FOR COMPARISON WITH GISS MODELS AND AN EFFICIENT TESTBED FOR EVALUATION AND PROTOTYPING OF PARAMETRIC REPRESENTATIONS. PROPOSED FOCUS ON THE SOUTHERN OCEAN. THE SOUTHERN OCEAN IS A REGION OF GREAT UNCERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO ITS ROLE IN HEAT AND CARBON BUDGETS AND THEIR RESPONSE TO CLIMATE CHANGE. IT WILL BE A MAIN FOCUS OF OUR ACTIVITIES. IN PARTICULAR WE AIM TO DESCRIBE AND ASSESS: 1.SENSITIVITY OF THE RESPONSE OF THE COUPLED MODEL TO CHANGES IN THE AIR/SEA MOMENTUM, HEAT, FRESHWATER FLUXES AND CARBON FLUXES. HOW ARE CHANGING WIND PATTERNS AND SURFACE BUOYANCY FLUXES AFFECTING THE SATURATION OF THE CARBON SINK IN THE SOUTHERN OCEAN. HOW IMPORTANT IS EDDY MIXING WHICH OPPOSES THE MEAN EKMAN TRANSPORT? HOW SENSITIVE IS STORAGE AND TRANSPORT OF HEAT AND CARBON IN THE SOUTHERN OCEAN TO MODEL PARAMETERIZATIONS? 3.HOW DOES THE PARAMETERIZATION OF VERTICAL MIXING AND HORIZONTAL EDDY TRANSPORTS PARAMETERIZATIONS AFFECT THE ESTIMATES OF THE GLOBAL CARBON EXPORT PRODUCTION TO THE DEEP OCEAN? 4. HOW SENSITIVE IS THE MAGNITUDE OF THE CLIMATE FEEDBACKS ASSOCIATED WITH SURFACE CARBON CONCENTRATIONS AND SST TO IN PRESENT DAY CLIMATE AND UNDER FUTURE PROJECTIONS OF ATMOSPHERIC CO2 CONCENTRATIONS?

doc.ContractDescription: THE ENVIRONMENTAL HISTORY OF EARTH'S OCEAN, ATMOSPHERE AND RELATED BIOSPHERE IS COMMONLY TRACKED THROUGH EVALUATING CARBON AND SULFUR ISOTOPE RECORDS IN SEDIMENTARY ROCKS. UNLIKE CARBON, SULFUR ISOTOPES REFLECT A BALANCE OF VARIOUS MICROBIAL PROCESSES. THE REDUCTIVE SIDE OF THE S CYCLE IS DOMINATED BY SULFATE REDUCING BACTERIA - A METABOLISM THAT IS PUTATIVELY QUITE OLD. IN COMPLEMENT TO SULFATE REDUCTION, THE OXIDATIVE SULFUR CYCLE IS DRIVEN BY A BROAD SUITE OF (A)BIOLOGICAL OXIDATION AND MICROBIAL DISPROPORTIONATION REACTIONS. THE GOAL OF THIS STUDY IS THE ISOTOPICALLY CHARACTERIZE MICROBIAL SULFUR DISPROPORTIONATION, AS THIS PROCESS IS POORLY UNDERSTOOD AND CAPABLE OF PRODUCING ENORMOUS, MASS-DEPENDENT ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS. GIVEN RECENT FINDINGS OF LARGE ISOTOPE EFFECTS AS A RESULT OF SULFATE REDUCTION (A WELL-CHARACTERIZED PROCESS), FURTHER CALIBRATING THE ISOTOPIC CONSEQUENCES OF DISPROPORTIONATION IS EVEN TIMELIER. HERE, THE INCLUSION OF THE MINOR SULFUR ISOTOPE - 33S - WILL ALLOW FOR THE ISOTOPIC FINGERPRINT OF DISPROPORTIONATION AND SULFATE REDUCTION TO BE UNIQUELY DIFFERENTIATED FROM ONE ANOTHER, EVEN WHEN THE CONVENTIONAL 34S/32S IS THE SAME. THIS PROJECT WILL PLACE NEW ISOTOPIC CONSTRAINTS ON THE MICROBIAL DISPROPORTIONATION OF SULFITE, THIOSULFATE AND ELEMENTAL SULFUR. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL TARGET GROWTH OF THE GENETICALLY TRACTABLE PURE CULTURE DESULFOCAPSA SULFEXIGENS (ALREADY IN CULTURE IN THE JOHNSTON LAB). USING CHEMOSTATS, WE WILL ESTABLISH THE CHARACTERISTIC 32S - 33S - 34S FRACTIONATION IMPOSED BY DISPROPORTIONATION ON THIOSULFATE, SULFITE AND ELEMENTAL S ACROSS A RANGE OF ENVIRONMENTALLY REASONABLE METABOLIC RATES. CHEMOSTAT EXPERIMENTS WILL BE UNDERPINNED BY BATCH EXPERIMENTS (ON EACH INTERMEDIATE) THAT WILL SERVE TO ESTABLISH MAXIMUM GROWTH RATES (NEEDED FOR PROPER CHEMOSTAT CALIBRATION). IN ADDITION TO SURVEYING RATE, THE ROLE OF FE, WHICH IS PROPOSED TO MODULATE SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATION IN THESE SYSTEMS, WILL BE MORE THOROUGHLY ASSESSED. IN COMPLEMENT TO MULTIPLE SULFUR ISOTOPE WORK, 18O/16O MEASUREMENTS WILL BE MADE ON SULFATE AS A MEANS OF FURTHER PROBING THE OXIDATIVE BRANCH OF THE DISPROPORTIONATION METABOLISM. ALONG WITH ANCILLARY GEOCHEMICAL DATA, ALL ISOTOPE DATA WILL THEN BE MODELED WITH THE GOAL OF DEVELOPING A CALIBRATED FRACTIONATION MODEL FOR SULFUR DISPROPORTIONATION. THIS WILL BRING OUR QUANTITATIVE UNDERSTANDING OF DISPROPORTIONATION TO A LEVEL THAT IS THEN SUFFICIENT TO REVISIT PALEO-ENVIRONMENTAL RECORDS. THIS INCREASED CALIBRATION WILL ALLOW FOR MORE REFINED RECONSTRUCTIONS OF PALEO ENVIRONMENTS. OF PARTICULAR INTEREST IS BETTER UNDERSTANDING THE PALEOZOIC, WHERE CURRENT CALIBRATIONS ARE INSUFFICIENT TO EXPLAIN SEDIMENTARY RECORDS. HOWEVER, THIS GENERAL CALIBRATION WILL ALSO INFORM A RANGE OF QUESTIONS AT THE HEART OF NASA'S BROADER GOALS, AS IT RELATES TO BETTER UNDERSTANDING THE "EARLY EVOLUTION OF LIFE AND THE BIOSPHERE" THROUGH TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF EARLY METABOLISMS AND PROLIFERATION OF THE BIOSPHERE THROUGH THE ENTIRE PRECAMBRIAN.
doc.MajorAgency: THE ISOTOPIC CONSEQUENCES OF MICROBIAL SULFUR DISP

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF

OBJECTIVES AND METHODS: WE PROPOSE TO SUBMIT THE ENTIRE SET OF KNOWN HIGH-SNR URANUS RING OCCULTATION OBSERVATIONS TO NASA'S PDS RINGS NODE FOR USE BY THE ENTIRE PLANETARY SCIENCE COMMUNITY. THESE OBSERVATIONS SPAN MORE THEN 25 YEARS (1977-2002), INCLUDING SEVERAL EARLY EVENTS THAT WERE RECORDED ONLY ON STRIP CHARTS, ADDITIONAL HIGH-SNR UNPUBLISHED GROUND-BASED OBSERVATIONS, TWO OCCULTATIONS OBSERVED FROM THE HUBBLE SPACE TELESCOPE, AND TWO OCCULTATIONS OBSERVED USING 2D IMAGING ARRAYS. WE WILL ARCHIVE BOTH THE FULL CONTINUOUS TIME SERIES OBSERVATIONS OF THE OCCULTATION, AS WELL HAS HIGH-RESOLUTION INDIVIDUAL RING EVENT PROFILES REGISTERED ON A RADIUS SCALE BASED ON A SELFCONSISTENT RING ORBIT MODEL ACCOUNTING FOR THE INCLINATIONS, ECCENTRICITIES OF THE RINGS, ALL FITTED NORMAL MODES, AND A DERIVED URANUS POLE DIRECTION. THE RESULTS WILL BE USEFUL FOR STUDIES OF THE DYNAMICS AND KINEMATICS OF THE RINGS, AS WELL AS THEIR INTERNAL STRUCTURE, AND FOR SETTING LIMITS OF THE GRAVITATIONAL HARMONICS OF URANUS ITSELF, AND HENCE ITS INTERNAL STRUCTURE AS WELL. WE WILL SUBMIT ALL RAW, INTERMEDIATE, AND HIGHER ORDER PRODUCTS TO THE PDS, ALONG WITH COMPLETE DOCUMENTATION AND MACHINE-READABLE TABLES OF KEY DERIVED QUANTITIES FOR EACH OBSERVED OCCULTATION AND RING PROFILE. THIS WILL ENABLE INTERCOMPARISON WITH OTHER PLANETARY RINGS, SUCH AS SATURN'S NARROW RINGLETS, AND ALLOW SYSTEMATIC SEARCHES TO BE MADE FOR PREVIOUSLY UNDETECTED RINGS OR RING ARCS IN THE URANUS SYSTEM THAT MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE DUSTY SHEETS OF MATERIAL ASSOCIATED WITH THE RINGS, AS SEEN IN VOYAGER FORWARDSCATTERING IMAGES. SCIENTIFIC IMPORTANCE, AND RELEVANCE TO NASA AND PDART THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO SUBMIT A COMPLETE SET OF URANUS RING OCCULTATION DATA TO THE PDS, INCLUDING SEVERAL PREVIOUSLY UNPUBLISHED OBSERVATIONS. AT PRESENT, ONLY THE VOYAGER 2 URANUS RING OCCULTATION DATA ARE IN THE PDS. THIS WORK WILL MAKE AVAILABLE TO THE ENTIRE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY A COMPLETE SURVEY OF 25 YEARS OF URANUS RING OCCULTATION OBSERVATIONS, A VALUABLE TOOL BOTH FOR COMPARATIVE STUDIES WITH OTHER RING SYSTEMS AND FOR NEW THEORETICAL, DYNAMICAL, AND OBSERVATIONAL STUDIES OF THE URANIAN RINGS THEMSELVES. THE DATA WILL BE IN AN ACCESSIBLE AND COMMON FORMAT IN THE PDS, ALLOWING FLEXIBLE ACCESS FOR ALL USERS. THESE RESULTS WILL BE COMPLEMENTARY TO THE EXTENSIVE SATURN RING DATA SETS ALREADY ARCHIVED IN THE PDS RINGS NODE. THERE IS RENEWED INTEREST IN THE URANIAN RINGS, PARTLY BECAUSE OF RECENT ADVANCES IN OUR UNDERSTANDING OF PLANETARY RINGS FROM THE ENORMOUSLY SUCCESSFUL CASSINI OBSERVATIONS OF SATURN S RINGS, AND ALSO BECAUSE URANUS IS A POTENTIAL TARGET FOR JWST OBSERVATIONS AND, IN THE LONGER TERM, FOR AN OUTER PLANET MISSION. SCIENTISTS INTERESTED IN COMPARING SATURN S RINGS WITH THE URANIAN, RINGS, IN THE CONNECTION BETWEEN SMALL SATELLITES AND RINGS, AND IN THE FORMATION AND DESTRUCTION OF NARROW RINGS AS AN ANALOG TO PLANETARY FORMATION, WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO MAKE USE OF THE URANIAN RING DATA SETS WE PROPOSE TO ARCHIVE. THE PROPOSED WORK FALLS SQUARELY WITHIN THE GOALS OF PDART TO GENERATE HIGHER-ORDER DATA PRODUCTS, ARCHIVE AND RESTORE DATA SETS OR PRODUCTS AND THEREBY TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT AND QUALITY OF DIGITAL INFORMATION AND DATA PRODUCTS AVAILABLE FOR PLANETARY SCIENCE RESEARCH AND EXPLORATION. THE USE OF PREVIOUSLY UNPUBLISHED DATA IS PERMITTED UNDER THE PDART AO: SOURCE DATA MAY BE DERIVED FROM ASTRONOMICAL OBSERVATIONS OR OTHER SOURCES.
doc.MajorAgency: RESTORATION AND SUBMISSION OF URANUS RING OCCULTAT
